titleStmt.title: Letter from Jerry L. Wright to Enid Neihardt, October 4. 1935
titleStmt.author: Wright, Jerry L.

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from Jerry L. Wright to Enid Neihardt, October 4. 1935

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

div1.p: I received your letter last week and enjoyed reading it very much. I had been looking forward to receiving a letter from you. I stayed in Shull alley about the days after you visited us there and I have been here in Grant - ville since. I am glad that you enjoyed your trip to the ranch and I surely hope you will be able to pay as a motehr visit there. I havne't traveled very much. I have been out of the State of Utah only once, that was to California two years ago. I spent the summer there. I enjoyed myself very much but I prefer that

climate here in Utah. I have always liked the winter time. The young people here, seem to be much social minded in the winter. That is the time when they will get together on sleighing on skating parties. I have never learned to skate, I regret to say. We have a beautiful canyon just a Ten miles from here, where we often go in the summer and eat spring on Canyon trips. We go and stay overnight on fox on Ninety days as we can, And I Love surely enjoyed a good many trips up there Your description of the Ozarks makes me very desirous of seeing them. I would surely like to visit you there and accompany you on one of your hikes.

but she prefers fresh water. Did you swim in the Lake while you were in Utah? My husband will not be home until the first of November and I am spending of my time now sewing and canning fruit. I belong to a sewing club and I am entertaining them on the sixteenth of this month. I hope I hear from you again soon and I will try to tell you something of interest about my part of the country.
